description.narrative:
Strengthening the country´s enabling environment for the fulfilment of human rights and pro-poor growth, building national capacity to deliver basic services while increasing coverage and quality, and responding quickly through humanitarian assistance which is tied to long-term development objectives.
Overall focus of the work being done in each area:
Economic Growth Supporting national achievement of economic growth, wealth creation, productivity enhancement and broad based pro-poor development. This is mainly done by policy advocacy, capacity development and knowledge-sharing via partnerships, investing in economic infrastructure and enabling national stakeholders. But also for example strengthening of national capacities in research, policy analysis and implementation on employment, poverty reduction and productivity enhancement.
Governance Strengthening GoT's (and other stakeholders) capacities to improve good governance, the rule of law, anti-corruption and respect, protection and fulfilment for human rights. This is by providing technical assistance, help with policy coordination, planning capacity, skills development etc. Interesting areas of interventions: Better monitoring and reporting in respect of national adherence to international treaty obligations and fulfilment of human rights, government reforms of the justice system (child and juvenile justice, women and GBV), election support by modernising management bodies, parliamentary oversight capacities and women leadership.
Social Protection Focus on public social protection mechanisms in Tanzania, both for addressing socio-economic vulnerabilities of the population and the need for protection services for children, women and families (rights-holders). Specifically, UNDAP provides technical assistance to ensure that a coherent policy, legislative and regulatory framework on social protection and protection of women and children is in place, and that functional institutional mechanisms for coordination are established. Through policy and budget analysis and costing of policy options, the UN further provides the resources and strengthens the capacity required to consolidate a substantive and credible evidence-base to inform policy decisions in social protection and protection of women and children. In addressing the need for more protective services for children and families, the UN ensures the development of a child protection system in the country, and strengthens child protection responses within the existing legal frameworks.

Support to UNDAP, United Nations Development Assistant Programme in Tanzania, part of OneUN by earmarking to two out of ten programmes; Economic growth and Economic Governance and Governance and mainstreaming of gender.

United Nations Development Assistance Plan (UNDAP) i Tanzania är designat för att stärka FN-systemets samstämmighet och effektivitet på nationell nivå, som bidrag till Tanzanias arbete för hållbar fattigdomsminskning och förverkligandet av mänskliga rättigheter. Den breda verksamheten motsvarar flera av de mål som anges i den svenska resultatstrategin för utvecklingssamarbetet med Tanzania 2013-2019. Tre av totalt tio fokusområden är särskilt relevanta för den svenska strategin: ekonomisk tillväxt; demokratisk samhällsstyrning; och socialt skydd. Området utbildning är också högst relevant, men har inte prioriterats, eftersom den svenska portföljen idag redan innefattar stort stöd till utbildningssektorn (GBS, GPE etc) och inget direkt mervärde bedöms skulle uppnås genom UNDAP-stöd. Den svenska strategin identifierar kvinnor, barn och ungdomar som prioriterade grupper, därför ska jämställdhetsintegrering utgöra en explicit komponent av UNDAP-stödet, så att jämställdhetsaspekter integreras i alla fokusområden men också kan vara aktiva delar i programmen inom ekonomisk tillväxt och demokratisk samhällssstyrning.
UNDAP är helt i linje med givarnas s k Joint Assistance Strategy for Tanzania (JAST) och med Tanzanias nationella strategier för fattigdomsminskning (MKUKUTA II för fastlandet och MKUZA II för Zanzibar) liksom Big Results Now (BRN) och den mer långsiktiga planen Long Term Perspectives Plan (LTPP). UNDAP förbättrar FN:s fokus på resultat genom att sammanföra ett 20-tal FN-organs planering, budgetering och rapportering i ett gemensamt resultatramverk för Tanzania. UNDAP minskar därför i viss utsträckning dubbelarbete för FN-organ och nationella partner.
Det svenska stödet ska ges via One UN Fund, i linje med Sveriges politik att stödja ett sammanhållet och mer effektivt FN-arbete i länderna (FN-reformen "Delivering as One", DaO). UNDP är det av FN utsedda FN-organ som administrerar One UN Fund (genom UNDP-kontoret i Dar es Salaam och huvudkontoret i New York), och UN Resident Coordinator (UNRC) FN:s högste representant i Tanzania, varför båda dessa står som FN:s undertecknande av SAA från 2011, och nu ska skriva under tilläggsavtalet (Addendum) med Sverige. I linje med Sveriges resultatstrategi för Tanzania kommer stödet inte att gå generellt till UNDAP, utan som öronmärkt till de tre nämnda programmen, valprojektet och projekt för ungdomssysselsättning samt till jämställdhetsintegrering av hela UNDAP och gender program under UN Women's ledning.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: A Completion Memo has already been produced and archived. Some overall reflections of the assessment of results from UNDAP I are:- Results are at policy level which is natural for UN with a normative mandate and is also assessed as the most effective way to use UN resources for larger results.- Results clearly relevant for national priorities and in areas of UN expertise - bearing potential for significant impact. - The challenges in implementation in Tanzania (despite policies in place etc) is acknowledged as possibly hampering results. - Difficulties and limitations in outreach geographically. Too many competing activities hampers performance and force constant choices between nationwide and more concentrated efforts. - Good immediate results, high quality and progress in many areas but where longer-term sustainability and continuity concerns are raised. - Progress in DaO reform but limited due to individual agency differences and delegations from HQ´s.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
